archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
name: Smoked Hake à Brás with Blistered Padrón Peppers
description: A Portuguese à Brás-style shredded smoked hake with crisp matchstick potatoes and creamy eggs, finished with olives and parsley, served alongside Spanish-style blistered Padrón peppers. A family showpiece with comforting textures and bright lemon.
prep_steps: Peel potatoes and cut into thin matchsticks; soak in cold water 20 minutes to remove starch, then drain and dry well with towels.
Beat eggs in a bowl with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Rinse smoked hake briefly; set aside.
Rinse and dry padron peppers; toss in a bowl with a little olive oil and salt.
Set out a large frying pan for potatoes, a wide sauté pan for the hake mix, and a baking tray for peppers.
cook_steps: In a medium pot, add smoked hake, bay leaves, and enough water to cover; bring to a gentle simmer on the stovetop for 6–8 minutes until just flaky. Drain, discard bay leaves, and flake the fish, removing any skin/bones.

Heat a large frying pan with 80 ml olive oil over medium-high heat. Fry dried potato matchsticks in batches until golden and crisp (6–8 minutes per batch). Transfer to a paper towel–lined tray and season with salt. Keep warm.
While frying potatoes, spread padron peppers on a baking tray, season with salt, and roast in the oven for 8–10 minutes until blistered, turning once. Hold in the switched-off oven to keep warm.
In a wide sauté pan, add 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Cook sliced onions with a pinch of salt until soft and pale golden, 8–10 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook 1 minute.
Add flaked smoked hake to the onions and warm through for 2–3 minutes, gently folding.
Reduce heat to low. Pour in beaten eggs and stir slowly with a spatula until just creamy and softly set, 2–3 minutes (do not scramble dry).
Fold in most of the crispy potatoes (reserve a handful for topping), chopped parsley, and most of the olives. Adjust salt and black pepper, and add a small drizzle of olive oil if needed.
Plate the à Brás. Top with reserved crispy potatoes and remaining olives. Serve with blistered padron peppers and lemon wedges on the side for squeezing.
